discoveredAssets: localhost:4567 - RepeatMePlease Flask web application - Port 4567, Werkzeug 3.1.3 (Python 3.13.3), Bootstrap 4.5.2

targets.objective: Test for server-side input validation bypass (special characters, SQL injection, NoSQL injection, command injection), integer boundary manipulation, business logic flaws in sentence repetition, and XSS in rendered output
targets.rationale: Primary endpoint accepting user-controlled input. Client-side validation present but must be tested server-side. Accepts sentence and number parameters with current restrictions; testing should verify if input validation can be bypassed, if reflected output is properly escaped, and if there are business logic flaws in repetition logic

keyFindings: [LOW] Minimal attack surface - only 2 endpoints discovered (GET /, POST /generate)
[LOW] Client-side input validation present - JavaScript regex restricts sentence to alphanumeric+spaces, number to max 200
[LOW] No API documentation exposed (no swagger.json, openapi.json, etc.)
[LOW] No debug endpoints or administrative interfaces discovered
[LOW] Proper HTTP method enforcement - 405 errors for unsupported methods
[INFORMATIONAL] Application uses Werkzeug 3.1.3 and Python 3.13.3 - both relatively recent versions
[INFORMATIONAL] Form-based input with POST-only endpoint suggests standard web form handling
